ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Auditory Processing Disorder (APD)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Normal peripheral hearing but significant deficits in auditory hypersensitivity, auditory integration (dichotic listening), and organization/sequencing.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Auditory Hypersensitivity
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Tolerance thresholds reduced to 65-70 dB HL, causing negative emotional and behavioral reactions to loud sounds.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Anxiety Disorder
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: History of anxiety contributes to emotional reactions, but audiologic testing confirms underlying physiological processing deficits.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To assess peripheral hearing sensitivity and rule out hearing loss.
To assess speech recognition thresholds and word recognition in quiet.
To evaluate middle ear function and acoustic reflexes.
To quantify tolerance levels for warbled tones and narrowband noise given complaints of sound intolerance.
To assess speech understanding in the presence of background noise (W-22 in noise, SCAN-3A AFG).
To assess temporal ordering and resolution (Pitch Pattern Sequence, Time Compressed Sentences).
To assess phonemic decoding and processing (Phonemic Synthesis, Filtered Words).
To assess binaural integration and separation abilities (Competing Words, Competing Sentences, SSW).

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Peripheral hearing sensitivity is within normal limits. However, the central auditory processing evaluation reveals significant deficits in auditory hypersensitivity (tolerance reduced to 65-70 dB HL) and auditory integration (dichotic listening deficits and sequencing errors). Temporal and phonological processing abilities are intact.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Normal hearing thresholds at 250 to 8,000 Hz bilaterally.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: Word Recognition Scores (WRS) 100% in both ears in quiet.

tests.name: Immittance audiometry
tests.result_summary: Normal ear canal volume, pressure, and compliance; reflexes normal 500-4000 Hz.

tests.name: Auditory Hypersensitivity Assessment
tests.result_summary: Significant hypersensitivity; tolerance thresholds 65-70 dB HL (normal >90 dB HL) with negative behavioral reactions.

tests.name: Speech-in-noise
tests.result_summary: Normal performance. W-22 in noise: 88% Right, 92% Left. SCAN-3A Auditory Figure-Ground: Scaled score 9 (normal).

tests.name: Auditory Temporal Processing
tests.result_summary: Normal. SCAN-3A Time Compressed Sentences scaled score 8. Pitch Pattern Sequence: 100% Right, 85% Left.

tests.name: Auditory Phonological Processing
tests.result_summary: Normal. Phonemic Synthesis: 25/25 correct. SCAN-3A Filtered Words: Scaled score 8.

tests.name: Dichotic Listening (Integration)
tests.result_summary: Abnormal. SCAN-3A Competing Words: Free Recall (5th %ile) and Directed Recall (1st %ile) abnormal. SSW: Abnormal errors and reversals; Ear Effect abnormal.

proposed_items: Sound therapy (e.g., The Listening Program / TLP) to improve processing and reduce hypersensitivity
Auditory training programs for integration (e.g., CAPDOTS)
Computer-based training for linguistic integration (e.g., Fast ForWord)
Use of graphic organizers for written assignments and work tasks
Recording class lectures (e.g., Tegrity) to review missed information
Accommodations: Note taker, extended time for exams/assignments
Written outlines or notes from supervisors at work
counseling_actions: Explain that hearing sensitivity is normal but the brain struggles to process and integrate sound (APD)
Discuss auditory hypersensitivity and the need to desensitize rather than over-use earplugs
Advise on self-advocacy for accommodations in educational and vocational settings

escalation.rationale_short: Patient agreed to return for a re-evaluation of auditory processing abilities after completing therapy.

follow_up_plan.timeline: During winter break (approx. 2 months after testing)
follow_up_plan.objective: Re-evaluation of auditory processing abilities to assess progress following therapy.

expected_outcome: Patient followed through and is presently completing The Listening Program (TLP) therapy and Fast ForWord training.
Patient is applying to college with special needs accommodations and hopes to secure tutoring and recording services.
Patient agreed to return for a re-evaluation of auditory processing abilities during winter break.
